node.title: 'We need to keep things out of landfill': Redcliffe Repair Cafe joins push for right to repair
node.alt: A woman holding a teal-green kitchen mixer
node.description: A community project to fix items that would otherwise be thrown into landfill has had major success. It comes as the Productivity Commission releases a report pushing for Australian consumer law changes.
node.content:
["It's Saturday morning on the picturesque Redcliffe Peninsula north of Brisbane, and Melissa Griffith's\u00a015-year-old KitchenAid is making a \"clicky sound\".", "The workhorse of Ms Griffith's kitchen, the\u00a0appliance is now being frowned over by a volunteer at the Redcliffe Repair Cafe, a community program aiming to reduce how many items are tossed into landfill each year.", "\"There's something happening with the gears, but to get it repaired in Australia I'd have to send it down to Melbourne, or send it to England,\" she said.", "The verdict is in: her KitchenAid will need to be left with a volunteer for a few days for further investigations.", "
'Things are reparable'
", "Ms Griffith is one of dozens of locals who have made appointments for the Redcliffe Repair Cafe's November meeting, bringing broken items to the volunteer set-up in the hope they can be fixed.", "A toy boat, pushbikes, a sewing machine, a wooden train set, a pressure-washer and a beautiful leadlight lamp are just some of the items dotted around tables through the Redcliffe neighbourhood centre.", "Electricians, cabinet-makers, mechanics \u2014\u00a0skilled workers with years of experience \u2014 have volunteered their time to glue, solder, rewire, screw and oil broken items brought in by the community.", "Redcliffe Repair Cafe founder Les Barkla said the volunteer initiative was a global push to reduce the number of items thrown out each year.", "", "
Repair Cafe Redcliffe founder Les Barkla with Griffith University professor of law Leanne Wiseman\u00a0at the November Repair Cafe meeting.(ABC Radio Brisbane: Lucy Stone)
", "\"This is a real community project where we try to help community members actually get items fixed because we need to keep things out of landfill,\" Mr Barkla said.", "Mr Barkla said the Redcliffe team had managed to fix 77 of 127 items in eight meetings this year, and it would have been more except many mass-manufactured items brought in were of such poor quality, they could not be fixed.", "", "
Old sewing machines, lamps and cooking equipment are all fixed at the Repair Cafe.(ABC Radio Brisbane: Lucy Stone)
", "The Redcliffe Repair Cafe is one of several in south-east Queensland\u00a0with cafes operating in Sandgate and Woolloongabba.", "Founded in Amsterdam in 2007, the Repair Cafe movement has grown to more than 2,200 cafes internationally, forming part of the Right to Repair movement calling for better consumer access to repairs.", "
'Unnecessary barriers'
", "Under Australian consumer guarantees, customers have rights when purchasing new items, such as the right to a refund or repair.", "But that can be hampered by warranty restrictions, copyright law, and the sheer cheapness of mass-manufactured\u00a0electrical items.", "", "
Simple repairs can often be completed on items, preventing them from being thrown out prematurely.(ABC Radio Brisbane: Lucy Stone)
", "This week, the federal Productivity Commission released a report into Right to Repair laws, recommending changes to Australia's consumer\u00a0and copyright laws.", "The report found there were \"significant and unnecessary barriers\" to repairing some products, and that repairs to consumer products were becoming increasingly difficult or even impossible\u00a0resulting in \"costly and wasteful outcomes\" for the community.", "\"Good product design, the reuse of materials that would otherwise end up in landfill, and greater awareness of consumer rights and responsibilities can all play a part in reducing harm to the environment caused by the needless disposal of products that are no longer desired,\" the report said.", "The\u00a0federal government is now considering the report.", "", "
Redcliffe Repair Cafe volunteer David Barkla working on a set of wooden toys from Ireland.(ABC Radio Brisbane: Lucy Stone)
", "
Cheaper to toss than repair
", "Griffith University professor Leanne Wiseman has been researching the right to repair movement for several years.", "Speaking to ABC Radio Brisbane while visiting the Redcliffe Repair Cafe in November, Professor Wiseman said if manufacturers were required to make items easily repairable, consumers would be more likely to keep items for longer.", "Often, she said, it was cheaper for manufacturers to replace the entire item rather than a single part.", "\"For example, I had a microwave recently that wasn't working. Everything about it was fine, but there was a problem with the sensor pad,\" she said.", "\"It was a simple exercise to replace a bit of wiring, but the manufacturer wasn't interested because it was out of their warranty period \u2026 I was really reluctant to put that into landfill, so I was able to get that repaired.", "", "
Volunteer repairer Wayne Mathie (right) works on a broken pressure-washer at the Redcliffe Repair Cafe in November.(ABC Radio Brisbane: Lucy Stone)
", "Volunteer repairer Wayne Mathie, who spent Saturday morning working on a pressure-washer and several appliances, said\u00a0for many people a simple fix was beyond their knowledge and capacity, meaning many items were unnecessarily thrown out.", "\"It is very satisfying to be able to fix that item and give it another year or three lease on life,\" he said."]
